title: X96-1059

sentences.text: Recognition of proper nouns in Japanese text has been studied as a part of the more general problem of morphological analysis in Japanese text processing -LRB- -LSB- 1 -RSB- -LSB- 2 -RSB- -RRB- .
It has also been studied in the framework of Japanese information extraction -LRB- -LSB- 3 -RSB- -RRB- in recent years .
Our approach to the Multi-lingual Evaluation Task -LRB- MET -RRB- for Japanese text is to consider the given task as a morphological analysis problem in Japanese .

Our morphological analyzer has done all the necessary work for the recognition and classification of proper names , numerical and temporal expressions , i.e. Named Entity -LRB- NE -RRB- items in the Japanese text .
Amorph recognizes NE items in two stages : dictionary lookup and rule application .
First , it uses several kinds of dictionaries to segment and tag Japanese character strings .
Second , based on the information resulting from the dictionary lookup stage , a set of rules is applied to the segmented strings in order to identify NE items .
When a segment is found to be an NE item , this information is added to the segment and it is used to generate the final output .

summary: Recognition of proper nouns in Japanese text has been studied as a part of the more general problem of morphological analysis in Japanese text processing -LRB- -LSB- 1 -RSB- -LSB- 2 -RSB- -RRB- . It has also been studied in the framework of Japanese information extraction -LRB- -LSB- 3 -RSB- -RRB- in recent years . Our approach to the Multi-lingual Evaluation Task -LRB- MET -RRB- for Japanese text is to consider the given task as a morphological analysis problem in Japanese . Our morphological analyzer has done all the necessary work for the recognition and classification of proper names , numerical and temporal expressions , i.e. Named Entity -LRB- NE -RRB- items in the Japanese text . The analyzer is called `` Amorph '' . Amorph recognizes NE items in two stages : dictionary lookup and rule application . First , it uses several kinds of dictionaries to segment and tag Japanese character strings . Second , based on the information resulting from the dictionary lookup stage , a set of rules is applied to the segmented strings in order to identify NE items . When a segment is found to be an NE item , this information is added to the segment and it is used to generate the final output .

Predicate-has_been_studied_as_a_part_of.label: has been studied as a part of
Predicate-has_been_studied_as_a_part_of.description: This predicate indicates that research or investigation on the subject has explored and examined aspects related to the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests a relationship of inclusion, where the subject's study encompasses or involves consideration of the object as part of its scope.

Predicate-is_involved_with.label: is involved with
Predicate-is_involved_with.description: Indicates a relationship of participation or association between two entities. The subject is engaged in an activity, process, or field that has some connection to the object, which can be another entity, concept, or task.

Predicate-considers.label: considers
Predicate-considers.description: The predicate 'considers' indicates that the subject has a thought process or opinion about the object, suggesting evaluation, assessment, or contemplation. It implies that the subject gives attention and mental effort to understand or weigh the significance of the object.

Predicate-has_done_all_the_necessary_wor.label: has done all the necessary work for
Predicate-has_done_all_the_necessary_wor.description: The predicate 'has done all the necessary work for' indicates that the subject has completed a specific task or set of tasks to achieve a particular goal or outcome, which is described by the object. The subject is portrayed as having taken care of everything required to accomplish this objective, and the object represents the result or consequence of their efforts.

Predicate-is_called.label: is called
Predicate-is_called.description: Indicates a naming or labeling relationship between the subject and object. The predicate 'is called' establishes an equivalence between the subject (a person, thing, or concept) and the object (its name, label, or designation).

Predicate-recognizes.label: recognizes
Predicate-recognizes.description: The predicate 'recognizes' indicates that the subject has a conscious awareness or understanding of the object. It implies a level of familiarity, knowledge, or comprehension about the object's characteristics, properties, or significance.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates a relationship of utilization or application between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has some kind of practical connection to the object, whether it be for obtaining information, achieving a goal, or performing an action.

Predicate-is_found_to_be.label: is found to be
Predicate-is_found_to_be.description: Indicates that an investigation or examination reveals a specific characteristic, property, or classification about the subject. The predicate connects the subject with its corresponding attribute or category.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject conceptually encompasses or includes the object as a more general category. It suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject represents a higher-level abstraction and the object represents a specific instance or subclass within that hierarchy.
